hackathon-description-text: The Leumi Hackathon is organised by Bank Leumi in partnership with Salesforce. Two days to build apps on the theme : "Inventing the bank of tomorrow."

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Deputy Chief Executive Officer of the Leumi Group
Executive vice president COO & CIO and head of Technologies devision at Bank Leumi
EVP - Head of Banking Division at Bank Leumi
Founder, CTO & Head of Product at BillGuard
Co-founder of the Viola Group, and a co-founder of Carmel Ventures

hackathon-rules: See the terms and conditions of the challenge

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First-place prize is NIS 100,000, 6 months office space and free community membership at Sosa with the benefits from Sosa's partners* and NIS 1,000 for acquiring services and an annual membership with full access to projects (value of NIS 2,000) at

Second-place prize is NIS 30,000, 3 MacBooks Air and an annual membership with full access to projects (value of NIS 1,000) at Xplace. The prize money will be evenly divided among the winning team members and it's 3 devices per team, regardless of

Third-place prize is NIS 15,000, 3 Nexus 7 Tabs and 6 months membership with full access to projects (value of NIS 560) at Xplace. The prize money will be evenly divided among the winning team members and it's 3 devices per team, regardless of

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Ganey Hatarucha, Bitan 10 TLV Convention Center  Rokach Blvd 101, Tel Aviv-Yafo, 61210

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Deliver a simple, complete user experience without any bugs.

Develop an understandable and user-­friendly user interface with a
good ‘navigability’.

Propose a new concept, target new domains using the potential of
provided dataset.

The project must respond to a real need, be marketable and be exploitable
by the teams of the Bank.

hackathon-location-address: Ganey Hatarucha, Bitan 10 TLV Convention Center  Rokach Blvd 101, Tel Aviv-Yafo, 61210
hackathon-description-header: A 36 hour straight marathon of code to build apps inventing the bank of tomorrow. NIS 145 000 cash prizes and more to win.
